list_definition.definition: to bargain or discuss a subject in order to agree

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We’ll have to negotiate a price.

list_definition.definition: to arrange (a treaty, payment etc), usually after a long discussion

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: It was hard enough to get the two sides to sit down and negotiate a peace agreement.

list_definition.definition: to get past (an obstacle or difficulty)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There still remain several obstacles to negotiate before a solution can be agreed on.

list_ex_of_english: In fact, its pictures and stories depend upon the negotiating power of fashion to make any sense at all.

They took advantage of new media and negotiated their way into early television showings in order to reach even greater numbers of spectators.

In this protected space, a contract was negotiated, which enabled boundaries to be established.

He demonstrates the crucial role of journalism and new communication technologies in negotiating the role between readers, the market and ways of knowing.
The transport mechanisms and protocols are supported (and enforced) by the infrastructure, while the content is negotiated between the components.
